        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header
          
          
            
               * with {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
          
          
            
               * */
          
          
            
               * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header with
          
          
            
               * {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
          
          
            
               */
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -686,6 +710,28 @@ public EnhancedBigtableStub(EnhancedBigtableStubSettings settings, ClientContext
   }
   // </editor-fold>
 
+  /**
+   * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header
+   * with {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
+   * */

nodes.bodyText: I dont think this is needed for the emulator as it will only be sent by the GFE. So I think this should go in the newBuilder factory method. However that also creates frictions for users that would want to install their interceptor. Now they have to worry about chaining it with ours. So I think this should be injected at the end in finalizeSettings?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -127,6 +128,7 @@ public ManagedChannelBuilder apply(ManagedChannelBuilder input) {
                 .setKeepAliveTime(Duration.ofSeconds(30)) // sends ping in this interval
                 .setKeepAliveTimeout(
                     Duration.ofSeconds(10)) // wait this long before considering the connection dead
+                .setInterceptorProvider(BigtableInterceptorProvider.createDefault())

nodes.bodyText: Removed the interceptor, using GrpcResponseMetadata instead.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -127,6 +128,7 @@ public ManagedChannelBuilder apply(ManagedChannelBuilder input) {
                 .setKeepAliveTime(Duration.ofSeconds(30)) // sends ping in this interval
                 .setKeepAliveTimeout(
                     Duration.ofSeconds(10)) // wait this long before considering the connection dead
+                .setInterceptorProvider(BigtableInterceptorProvider.createDefault())

nodes.bodyText: I think it would be better to name this FixedIterceptorProvider and put this in the gaxx package and then in the future to move it to gax proper. (This implies that the construction of the ClientHEaderInterceptor should move out of this class to the caller)
I think this should be extracted into its own Callable that injects the CallOptions into the passed in ApiCallOptions
I would try to wrap both values in a single object to minimize the overhead of adding CallOptions entries which is backed by an array
I would add a comment that this shouldn't ever happen because the tracer is injected in ....
I'm also a little concerned about flooding the customer logs here. If the tracer is missing, it is quite likely that it will be missing for all of the requests. So this will log for every request

I would keep this as a private method and instead expose concrete helpers that describe what you are recording: ie recordGfeLatency(String method, Duration duration)
recordMissingGfeHeader(String method)

Should this be exposed to users? Unless there is a specific reason to access something, we should limit the exposed surface so that we can evolve our internal apis without worrying about breaking users
Updated to InternalApi. This class still needs to be public so EnhancedStubSettings and EnhancedStub can use it.
We should discuss if these should be part of the standard exposed metrics

nodes.bodyText: We should avoid exposing this to customers. It's an implementation detail for the current approach. When this gets pushed into gax, we will move this into ApiTracer so we should minimize the amount public methods exposed (even if Beta). if this needs to be public then it should be INternalApi
Updated functions to protected.
Do we need to record anything here?

This logic is moved to HeaderTracer.
I decided to keep this so if in any case gfe_latency is not recorded (for example, if the regex failed), we can check if gfe metrics were being tracked by check if gfe_header_missing_count recorded any values.
Same flooding concern as above
Also consider using auto-value
Refactored HeaderTracer to use autovalue.
Can you make this map instance shared with the attrs above?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -203,7 +205,25 @@ public static EnhancedBigtableStubSettings finalizeSettings(
                         .build()),
                 // Add user configured tracer
                 settings.getTracerFactory())));
-
+    builder.setHeaderTracer(
+        builder
+            .getHeaderTracer()
+            .toBuilder()
+            .setStats(stats)
+            .setTagger(tagger)
+            .setStatsAttributes(
+                ImmutableMap.<TagKey, TagValue>builder()

nodes.bodyText: do these have to be public?
do we need the getters on the builder?
Unless I;m mistaken, this shouldnt be necessary, autovalue should do null checks for all properties that arent marked Nullable
Please add a comment as to when spanName might be null. Its a bit surprising to me
I think these should be final
Precondition checks would be good here

Please add a comment as to what this does. It will be helpful for future maintainers..Something like:
This callable will inject GrpcResponseMetadata into the ApiCallOptions. Upon rpc completion, gax will inject grpc trailers into this class. The trailers will then be processed by HeaderTracer

nodes.bodyText: Please add a lot more docs explaining why you'd wanna do this. Also,@BetaApi
RpcViews class is already marked with @BetaApi so I'm skipping adding it here
I think this needs to be atomic because this is set by a test thread and read by a server thread. Otherwise the cpu cache line might not be flushed
Would you mind adding tests that ensure that the metric is incremented when server returns a non-ok status as well?
final?
final?
I think this is a personal taste thing, but why go through mockito for this? Wouldnt it be simpler to just implement a fake BigtableImplBase?
nit. testDefaultBuilder()
